text: here at everyday food we're always
looking for recipes that take little to
no time at all and today's recipe well
it takes eight hours to set only takes
about five minutes to put together it's
a lemon raspberry semifreddo in a
blender combines 6 ounces of raspberries
and 2 tablespoons of sugar you just
blend in this up to make a sauce and
you're going to soak some ladyfingers in
it
just going to need to stop and scrape
down the blender once or twice so that
everything combines really nicely scrape
down your blender including the top it
seems to have been quite aggressive pass
the raspberry puree through a fine sieve
to remove the seeds you just want a nice
smooth raspberry sauce to soak your
ladyfingers in when I was in culinary
school I worked in the pastry shop of a
restaurant called Park Avenue cafe and
we used to make raspberry sorbet every
night and we served like 300 people a
night or more and I had to pass all the
raspberry puree through a sieve a sieve
even finer than this a xinhua which is a
very fine French sieve my god it took
four but it's delicious sorbet okay I
think I've gotten enough of the puree
out scrape off the bottom so you don't
waste any I have two cups of heavy cream
in this bowl I will be whipping it to
soft peaks and then combining it with
the lemon curd I like to start a little
slow when I'm whipping cream it has a
tendency to fly all over the place it's
a little bit like confectioner sugar in
that way once it starts to thicken then
you can speed it up and it won't
splatter all over the place as much all
right
I haven't even off by four and a half
inch loaf and lined with plastic wrap
that's what I'm going to put my
semifreddo in after that I have a cup of
pre-made lemon curd I purchased this you
can certainly make your own if you want
we have lots of recipes on our website
Martha Stewart comm you want to fold
your one cup of lemon curd into the
whipped cream fold it in the lemon curd
which is a custard is going to keep the
whipped cream from completely freezing
solid and allow it to have a really
smooth texture once it's frozen don't
over fold it when it seems nicely
combined then you're going to pour half
of it into your loaf pan this is an
eight and a half by four and a half inch
loaf pan that I lined with plastic and
I'm going to pour half of my cream
mixture into the pan
you're making a beautiful very elegant
layered dessert that takes basically no
time ten minutes to prep and eight hours
in the freezer and you can serve this to
anybody the Queen of England should you
happen by take ten lady fingers and then
just soak them a little bit in the
raspberry syrup that you made dip the
whole thing just turning to coat and
then line them on top of the semifreddo
mixture inside your loaf pan doesn't
really matter what way you do it the way
we did it was parallel and you get these
nice little half moons at the ends but
however you want the raspberry puree
will soften the ladyfingers slightly as
this freezes as will the cream so that
you'll be able to slice through them
like cake don't get rid of the rest of
this raspberry sauce port over the
ladyfingers so that it'll absorb in as
it sits in the freezer then spread the
rest of the cream mixture on top of the
ladyfingers smooth it out wrap it up and
put it in the freezer for eight hours
and you have does it practically no work
after eight hours it's time for the big
reveal
unwrap the plastic take the platter and
put it on top of the loaf pan and then
turn it upside down pull the pan off
remove the plastic I like to use a knife
dipped in hot water and then dried off
in order to slice with really nice clean
slices and then I dip between each slice
so it doesn't get too messy make sure
you let it sit at room temperature for
about ten minutes before you slice it
and you'll have a really fantastic
creamy texture possibly the easiest
